page.title: 04THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The owners bought the shop in 1984. They sell general groceries, sweets, newspapers and have fresh meat for sale twice weekly. They sell a variety of goods including cotton,needles,toys food,fresh bread and milk.Bread costs 50p for a large loaf. They sell a crate of milk(20 pints) per day at 23p per pint.Longlife milk is 27p a pint. Butter varies from 52p per \ pound to 62p. As the government subsidy has now stopped the prices will be increasing. Old potatoes cost 7_8p per pound. New potatoes range from 20p (Spanish) to 40p per pound (local). The local potatoes are so dear as they tend to be sold to the cities which pay higher prices, being the first new potatoes in Britain. Shop hours are 9_1,& 2.30_5.30, Mon to Fri; 9_12 Sat; CLOSED Sun.
